intro: Cistanthe humilis, commonly known as the desert lily, is a low-growing, perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Cistanthe humilis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is considered an important component of desert ecosystems.
